title: I mocked the Saudi leader on YouTube - then my phone was hacked and I was beaten up in London
description: Satirist Ghanem al-Masarir has been awarded £3m in damages, but it's unclear if Saudi Arabia will pay.
content:
With hundreds of millions of views, YouTuber Ghanem al-Masarir was flying high.
From his flat in Wembley, the loud-mouthed and sometimes offensive comedian was making waves as a critic of the Saudi Arabian royal family. But as well as fans, he'd made... [5515 chars]

title: Luke Littler reaches World Masters round two after scare in Milton Keynes
description: World number one Luke Littler comes through a "tough" night to win his first-round game after opponent Mike de Decker misses a match dart.
content:
Reigning world champion Luke Littler survived a major scare as he progressed to the second round of the World Masters in Milton Keynes.
Despite winning the opening set, the 19-year-old faced defeat as Mike de Decker levelled the contest by hitting a ... [604 chars]

title: Catherine O'Hara, who starred in Home Alone and Schitt's Creek, has died
description: She died on Friday at her home in Los Angeles, aged 71, "following a brief illness", her agency, Creative Artists Agency, said in a statement.
content:
Catherine O'Hara, the Emmy-winning actress who starred as Kevin's mother in Home Alone and the eccentric Moira Rose in Schitt's Creek, has died.
The Canadian-American star won an Emmy award for lead actress for her role in Schitt's Creek in 2020.
She... [2556 chars]

title: Labubu to open seven UK shops, after PM's China visit
description: The furry dolls have a signature spiky-toothed grin and became a viral purchase last summer.
content:
Seven new shops for Labubu dolls are to open in the UK this year, following the prime minister's trip to China.
Chinese toy maker Pop Mart has confirmed it will open a flagship shop on Oxford Street in London's West End, as well as shops in Cardiff a... [2103 chars]

title: US DoJ opens federal civil rights investigation into killing of Alex Pretti
description: Deputy attorney general makes announcement over fatal shooting in Minneapolis as fierce protests there continue
content: The US deputy attorney general announced on Friday that the justice department has opened a federal civil rights investigation into the fatal shooting of the Minneapolis nurse Alex Pretti last Saturday by immigration officers, as fierce protests cont... [6351 chars]
